website_summaries.verdict: Built to give you comfort, support, and protection in your longest hikes, the Merrell Forestbound Mid WP is a heavy-duty leather boot that is touted for its fantastic performance on the trail. It has gotten high marks for its robust construction, high-quality cushioning, and sheer lightness. Despite some concerns over its ability to guard the feet from extreme rain and water, this shoe still makes a great pick for both recreational and serious hikers. However, people who are wide-footed should check first if this boot fits them comfortably before making a purchase.
pros: The vast majority of Merrell Forestbound Mid WP reviews talk about its top-notch comfort
Many people are greatly impressed by how these lightweight hiking boots made their trips to the trail more enjoyable
A significant number of customers, including those suffering from foot pain, find it very supportive
Lots of verified buyers highly recommend this Merrell outdoor boot for its quality construction
A handful of users are amazed by the boot’s cushioning which has allowed them to walk for hours without tiring
cons: Several customers are disappointed with the waterproof qualities of this boot
A handful of reviewers find the Merrell Forestbound Mid WP hiking boots somewhat narrow

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable boots but NOT waterproof
customer_reviews.text: These are without doubt the most comfortable boots I have ever owned and from that perspective they are everything you would expect from a brand such as Merrel. Sadly they are as waterproof as my Crocks and anything from damp grass or moorland to a heavyish rain shower will have your feet feeling soggy within a couple of minutes. I have worn these extensively in dry conditions over the winter and through the spring, but have now had wet feet on three occasions within the last week, in conditions in conditions the boots should have dealt with easily. There is no point having walking boots if they are not waterproof, especially at this price. So disappointed Merrel!
customer_reviews.author: Coinneachmhor

customer_reviews.title: Narrower than expected but well made
customer_reviews.text: I know Merrell's come up short - that's nothing new really - but they are narrower than they used to be too, for some reason. I need a pair of waterproof boots for dog walking duties so I bought a size 8 even though I have only size 7 to 7.5 feet, and yes the size 8 does feel short but not uncomfortably so. However, the width IS uncomfortable. I would have returned them but I was desperate for them and stick with them hoping they'd "give" a little over time. And yes they have, to a point. They're definitely not my favourite shoes but I can say they are waterproof and appear to built well.
customer_reviews.author: 265bhp

customer_reviews.title: I bought these in November they have split already!
customer_reviews.text: I paid good money for these and in just over 6 months they have split. I had a pair of Merrells before lasted 5 years. I went and bought a pair of Columbia boots they lasted 6 months £115. So I went back to Merrells absolutely disappointing. I do not go trekking, hiking, extreme sport i walk my dog on the beach and in the woods. They have not been snagged this is poor seems. I would really like my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Barrington

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are great. Warm : suooortive and very light weight. I went in anhuge dig walk the first day I wore them and had absolutely no issues. The only problem is you literally don’t want to take them off! I lived in them for about the first 3 weeks . Boyfriend and 2 friends have also bought them now ( Boyf bought the men’s version obvs!)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy. As someone with wide feet I struggle sometimes to find comfort but Merrell always seem to get it right for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Chad Davies

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been having some problems with the tendons in one foot, the podiatrist diagnosed a ganglion, the only way I could walk without pain was an old pair of merrell walking boots, but they wore out. So ordered this pair and there even more comfortable. A very very happy 😀.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Moffat

customer_reviews.title: Good boots , so far
customer_reviews.text: I have only warn these boots a couple of times since they arrived, so far so good. NOT been warn in heavy rain yet so I'll reserve judgment for the moment. Fit is very good not as some reviews stated too narrow, overall ok.
customer_reviews.author: ursula carr

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Great lair of boots only worn for 3 weeks so far but still like new
customer_reviews.author: philip sewell

customer_reviews.title: Inner lining came loose within a month.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, unfortunately inner lining came loose within a month of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mr P. Edmundson

customer_reviews.title: Top marks
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy, light, warm and waterproof. There is a little give as were a little tight but after a week wearing an hour a day for dog walks they are spot on. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GBB

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Have worn the boots 3 times very comfy haven't tried them in the wet so can't comment
customer_reviews.author: Shorty

customer_reviews.title: Immediate comfort and no need for breaking in
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable straight out of the box. First walk 6.5 miles and no discomfort so very happy with the purchase during the first week of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Daw

customer_reviews.title: Look great
customer_reviews.text: Look a good quality boot they are a Christmas present so fingers crossed
customer_reviews.author: SHIRLEY HODGSON

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Sold as "waterproof " walked through wet grass in the rain and socks wet on return. CRAP.
customer_reviews.author: joseph m maundrill

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Boots are very comfortable and sturdy, can't comment on the waterproofing as not been out in the wet in them yet
customer_reviews.author: A Endean

customer_reviews.title: They are not WATERPROOF
customer_reviews.text: It stated they were waterproof, that is why I was a willing to spend nearly £100.00 on them. To my annoyance they are NOT
customer_reviews.author: Mrs E C Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing So comfortable So durable So worth the extra money
customer_reviews.author: catherine jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. Comfy and waterproof. Good quality as expected with merrel.
customer_reviews.author: Martin C.

customer_reviews.title: well made /comfy/ lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Used for hiking- pretty good boot- no rubbing. Needs additional proofing to be waterproof around sole to upper seam area
customer_reviews.author: strider

customer_reviews.title: comfortable but slippery when wet
customer_reviews.text: very comfortable,and soft, not much grip, can be slippy on wet
customer_reviews.author: rwc

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and smart
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Really comfortable, look good. Good value too.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Joe

customer_reviews.title: comfortable
customer_reviews.text: these boots are a good price, fit well - use them for long walks over varied terrain.
customer_reviews.author: acrylic

customer_reviews.title: Warm and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Unlike a lot of other boots in this category, these little beauties are incredibly lightweight yet sturdy. Usually, you'll sacrifice one for the other, but not with these. Nice and warm, too. Recommended if you don't want every walk to end feeling like you've just done 'leg day' at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: 19DCB73

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Forestbound Mid Waterproof High Rise Hiking Boots
product_meta.description: Go forth and conquer in this protective pack-ready leather hiker, built with cushion for comfort during your longest hikes. It features waterproof pu coated leather and mesh upper and has protective die cut rubber rand and toe cap. M select fresh antimicrobial agents reduces shoe odorand has breathable mesh lining. Kinetic fit base insole is contoured like your foot and provides flexible, intuitive support for connected and protected movement. It has molded nylon arch shank with eva midsole for stability and comfort. 5mm lug depth.
feature_bullets: Waterproof Pu Coated Leather And Mesh Upper
Protective Die Cut Rubber Rand And Toe Cap
Kinetic Fit Base Insole Is Contoured Like Your Foot And Provides Flexible, Intuitive Support For Connected And Protected Movement
Eva Midsole For Stability And Comfort
